clinical_study.brief_title: Internet-Delivered Cognitive Behaviour Therapy for Adolescent Depression
clinical_study.official_title: Guided Internet-Delivered and Tailored Cognitive Behaviour Therapy for Adolescents With Depression: a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether tailored internet-administrated cognitive behaviour therapy (CBT) is a feasible approach in the treatment of depressive symptoms and comorbid anxiety symptoms.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Be between the ages of 15-19 years old
- Have symptoms of depression, major depression
Exclusion Criteria:
- Suicidal ideation
- Alcohol addiction
- other major primary psychiatric disorder
- Ongoing psychological treatment
- recent (during last 4 weeks) change in psychiatric medication
